subject: Re: Unlocking GenAI for Procurement at Ethara
body:
Hi Abdul,

Ramadan mubarak to you and your team!

As *Ethara* looks to leverage *GenAI* on top of *Oracle Fusion* and
*iSupply*, I believe *Dice* can offer a unique value proposition—enhancing
procurement efficiency and decision-making while seamlessly integrating
with your existing systems.

Here’s how *Dice* can add value to Ethara’s procurement operations:

   - *AI-Driven Procurement*: Smart vendor selection, guided buying, and
   real-time insights to streamline your procurement process.
   - *LLM-Based Accounts Payable*: Automates invoice validation, policy
   enforcement, and reconciliation for faster, more accurate financial
   processing.
   - *Seamless Data Layer Integration*: Works effortlessly with your
   current architecture, enhancing spend intelligence and ensuring compliance.

We’re already driving AI-led transformations for *GF Cory* & *Tolaram* in
the Middle East, improving procurement workflows and maximizing savings.

Let’s explore how *Dice* can take *Ethara’s procurement* to the next level.
Would *March 8th or 10th* around *2 PM* work for a quick discussion?

Looking forward to your thoughts!

Regards,


*Himanshi JoshiGrowth Consultant*

*+91-9630827366*

Dice
www.dice.tech

[image: https://www.linkedin.com/in/himanshi-joshi-39ba12202/]
<https://www.linkedin.com/in/himanshi-joshi-39ba12202/>

<https://dice.tech/>

The use case revolves around efficiently distinguishing between business-related visits and personal visits throughout the day, without the need for repeatedly starting and stopping journey tracking.
Our proposed solution addresses this challenge by introducing a 
Check-In functionality at each client location. This allows users to mark business visits seamlessly while providing the option to tag deviations for personal trips, ensuring these are excluded from business visits.
This approach offers enhanced compliance and visibility by capturing end-to-end information on client interactions and visit patterns. Additionally, with our solution, all visit data can be seamlessly synced with your CRM, creating a unified
 and accurate view of client engagements

Questionnaire for Expense Tracking System:

6. What authentication mechanisms APIs supports (e.g., OAuth 2.0, API keys)?

 

7. Is there any IP whitelisting option or additional security requirements that needs to be configured?

 

8. What is the API payload size and call limits for API requests?

 

9. Is there any maximum size limit for attachments and what are the supported formats (e.g., PDF, JPEG, PNG)?

 

10. How integration errors are communicated (e.g., error codes, response messages)?

 

11. Does APIs support retry mechanisms for failed transactions?

 

12. Is there a sandbox or test environment we can use for integration testing?

        If yes, how are these attachments linked to a specific transaction?

              

17. How does Expense Tracking System handle invoice status updates sent back from Oracle?

19. Is there a way to log or track changes for audit purposes?

Re: Elevating Procurement Accuracy at Tabreed with Agentic AI
body:
Hi Majd,

Ramadan Mubarak to you and your team!

While Tabreed is currently using *Business ChatGPT* for analytics, but
with *~60%
accuracy*, it's not delivering the level of precision needed for effective
procurement decision-making.

*Dice’s PurchaseGPT*, powered by *Agentic AI*, provides a significant leap
in performance with *>90% accuracy* and offers the following capabilities
to elevate your procurement:

   - *Context-Aware Guided Buying*: AI-driven vendor selection & sourcing
   optimization, ensuring better alignment with your procurement goals.
   - *Dynamic Prompt Engineering*: Procurement-specific intelligence that
   continuously refines responses, adapting to changing requirements in
   real-time.
   - *Seamless Integration with Business Central*: Ensures accurate spend
   visibility and robust compliance monitoring for smarter financial
   management.
   - *Real-Time Spend Analytics*: Actionable insights for better budget
   control, cost savings, and supplier performance optimization.
   - *Automated Compliance Checks*: Minimize risks by automating compliance
   across your procurement categories, ensuring regulatory alignment.

[image: Thumbnail for the playlist PurchaseGPT v1.0]

We are already driving procurement intelligence for *GF Cory* & *Tolaram*,
achieving enhanced decision-making, reduced errors, and optimized supplier
relationships.

Let’s discuss how *Dice* can streamline and elevate Tabreed’s procurement
workflows for greater impact.

Would *March 8th* or *10th** around 2 PM* work for a brief discussion?

Looking forward to hearing from you!

subject: Re: Great meeting at MIDDLE EAST PROCURETECH SUMMIT
body:
Hi Ramveer,

I hope you're doing well and Ramadan Mubarak to you and your team!

Building on our discussion, I wanted to dive deeper into how Dice can take
Acme Engineering’s procurement to the next level.

A procurement process that doesn't just streamline sourcing but makes every
step smarter and more efficient. With *Dice*, you get an AI-driven solution
that goes beyond automation to provide:

   - *AI-Powered Vendor Selection*: Dice uses real-time data and AI to
   match Acme Engineering with the best suppliers, ensuring not just cost
   savings but faster, more reliable procurement decisions.
   - *Automated Compliance Checks*: Ensuring that your sourcing processes
   across sectors like oil & gas and cement remain compliant without extra
   manual effort.
   - *End-to-End Automation*: From *accounts payable*, *vendor inspection*,
   to *T&E management* and *automated utility payments*, Dice brings
   seamless integration to the forefront, eliminating inefficiencies and human
   error.
   - *Real-Time Analytics*: Access deep insights into your spend patterns,
   supplier performance, and savings opportunities, all through Dice’s
   intuitive reporting engine.

With *Dice*, Acme Engineering can ensure smarter sourcing, stronger
supplier relationships, and significantly faster procurement cycles—all
while maintaining control, transparency, and compliance across key
categories.

Would *March 7th, Friday* work for a quick 20-minute call to explore how we
can apply this to Acme Engineering’s specific needs?

Looking forward to hearing from you!
Regards,


*Himanshi JoshiGrowth Consultant*

*+91-9630827366*

Dice
www.dice.tech

Hi Shiv Sir,

I hope you are doing well!

It was a pleasure connecting with you today and gaining insights into Geco's current Intake-to-Procure process.

As discussed, we are happy to configure your current Intake-to-Procure requirements within Dice.

To proceed with the configuration, we would require the following details:

  *   Vendor Master
  *   Item Master
  *   PO Details
  *   Questionnaire for QCS (Quality Control & Safety)
Please find attached the Vendor Master, Product Master, and PO Details sheet for your reference. Kindly provide the necessary details in the same format.

Additionally, please let me know if the following QCS questionnaire works for you:

1. Product/Service Specifications & Quality:

  *   Can you provide sample test reports for material quality (e.g., strength, durability, safety)?
  *   Are your materials eco-friendly or sustainable, and do they meet green building standards?
  *   What is the expected lifespan and maintenance requirement of the product?
2. Construction Performance & Reliability:

  *   Have your products been used in similar construction projects? Can you provide case studies or references?
  *   What is the failure rate or defect ratio observed in real-world applications?
  *   Do you perform quality checks during manufacturing and pre-dispatch inspections?
3. Safety, Security & Compliance:

  *   Do your products comply with safety regulations (e.g., fire resistance, seismic safety, electrical safety)?
  *   Are they certified by relevant authorities (e.g., NABL, ISI, CE marking)?
  *   Do you provide Material Safety Data Sheets (MSDS) for hazardous materials?
  *   How do you ensure compliance with local building codes and environmental regulations?
4. Cost & Payment Terms:

  *   What is your pricing structure, and are there volume discounts or bundled packages?
  *   What are the payment terms, including advance payments, credit terms, and retention money?
  *   Are there any hidden costs (e.g., shipping, installation, taxes)?
  *   Do you offer flexible financing options or long-term contracts?
5. Risk Management & Liability:

  *   What is your insurance coverage and liability in case of product failure or accidents?
  *   Do you provide indemnity and warranty clauses?
  *   What is your dispute resolution mechanism in case of contractual disagreements?
Next Steps: Please confirm if the above questionnaire works for QCS, or let me know if any changes are required.

If you need any further clarification or additional details, feel free to reach out.

Looking forward to your response!

Best regards,

Hi Shiv Sir,

I hope you are doing well!

It was a pleasure connecting with you today and gaining insights into Geco's current Intake-to-Procure process.

As discussed, we are happy to configure your current Intake-to-Procure requirements within Dice.

To proceed with the configuration, we would require the following details:


Vendor Master
Item Master
PO Details
Questionnaire for QCS (Quality Control & Safety)
Please find attached the Vendor Master, Product Master, and PO Details sheet for your reference. Kindly provide the necessary details in the same format.

Additionally, please let me know if the following QCS questionnaire works for you:

 

1. Product/Service Specifications & Quality:




Can you provide sample test reports for material quality (e.g., strength, durability, safety)?
Are your materials eco-friendly or sustainable, and do they meet green building standards?
What is the expected lifespan and maintenance requirement of the product?


2. Construction Performance & Reliability:




Have your products been used in similar construction projects? Can you provide case studies or references?
What is the failure rate or defect ratio observed in real-world applications?
Do you perform quality checks during manufacturing and pre-dispatch inspections?


3. Safety, Security & Compliance:




Do your products comply with safety regulations (e.g., fire resistance, seismic safety, electrical safety)?
Are they certified by relevant authorities (e.g., NABL, ISI, CE marking)?
Do you provide Material Safety Data Sheets (MSDS) for hazardous materials?
How do you ensure compliance with local building codes and environmental regulations?


4. Cost & Payment Terms:




What is your pricing structure, and are there volume discounts or bundled packages?
What are the payment terms, including advance payments, credit terms, and retention money?
Are there any hidden costs (e.g., shipping, installation, taxes)?
Do you offer flexible financing options or long-term contracts?


5. Risk Management & Liability:




What is your insurance coverage and liability in case of product failure or accidents?
Do you provide indemnity and warranty clauses?
What is your dispute resolution mechanism in case of contractual disagreements?

Next Steps: Please confirm if the above questionnaire works for QCS, or let me know if any changes are required.

If you need any further clarification or additional details, feel free to reach out.

Looking forward to your response!

Best regards,

Hi Shiv Sir,

I hope you are doing well!

It was a pleasure connecting with you today and gaining insights into Geco's current Intake-to-Procure process.

As discussed, we are happy to configure your current Intake-to-Procure requirements within Dice.

To proceed with the configuration, we would require the following details:


Vendor Master
Item Master
PO Details
Questionnaire for QCS (Quality Control & Safety)
Please find attached the Vendor Master, Product Master, and PO Details sheet for your reference. Kindly provide the necessary details in the same format.

Additionally, please let me know if the following QCS questionnaire works for you:

 

1. Product/Service Specifications & Quality:




Can you provide sample test reports for material quality (e.g., strength, durability, safety)?
Are your materials eco-friendly or sustainable, and do they meet green building standards?
What is the expected lifespan and maintenance requirement of the product?


2. Construction Performance & Reliability:




Have your products been used in similar construction projects? Can you provide case studies or references?
What is the failure rate or defect ratio observed in real-world applications?
Do you perform quality checks during manufacturing and pre-dispatch inspections?


3. Safety, Security & Compliance:




Do your products comply with safety regulations (e.g., fire resistance, seismic safety, electrical safety)?
Are they certified by relevant authorities (e.g., NABL, ISI, CE marking)?
Do you provide Material Safety Data Sheets (MSDS) for hazardous materials?
How do you ensure compliance with local building codes and environmental regulations?


4. Cost & Payment Terms:




What is your pricing structure, and are there volume discounts or bundled packages?
What are the payment terms, including advance payments, credit terms, and retention money?
Are there any hidden costs (e.g., shipping, installation, taxes)?
Do you offer flexible financing options or long-term contracts?


5. Risk Management & Liability:




What is your insurance coverage and liability in case of product failure or accidents?
Do you provide indemnity and warranty clauses?
What is your dispute resolution mechanism in case of contractual disagreements?

Next Steps: Please confirm if the above questionnaire works for QCS, or let me know if any changes are required.

If you need any further clarification or additional details, feel free to reach out.

Looking forward to your response!

Best regards,

Hi Shiv Sir,

I hope you are doing well!

It was a pleasure connecting with you today and gaining insights into Geco's current Intake-to-Procure process.

As discussed, we are happy to configure your current Intake-to-Procure requirements within Dice.

To proceed with the configuration, we would require the following details:


Vendor Master
Item Master
PO Details
Questionnaire for QCS (Quality Control & Safety)
Please find attached the Vendor Master, Product Master, and PO Details sheet for your reference. Kindly provide the necessary details in the same format.

Additionally, please let me know if the following QCS questionnaire works for you:

 

1. Product/Service Specifications & Quality:




Can you provide sample test reports for material quality (e.g., strength, durability, safety)?
Are your materials eco-friendly or sustainable, and do they meet green building standards?
What is the expected lifespan and maintenance requirement of the product?


2. Construction Performance & Reliability:




Have your products been used in similar construction projects? Can you provide case studies or references?
What is the failure rate or defect ratio observed in real-world applications?
Do you perform quality checks during manufacturing and pre-dispatch inspections?


3. Safety, Security & Compliance:




Do your products comply with safety regulations (e.g., fire resistance, seismic safety, electrical safety)?
Are they certified by relevant authorities (e.g., NABL, ISI, CE marking)?
Do you provide Material Safety Data Sheets (MSDS) for hazardous materials?
How do you ensure compliance with local building codes and environmental regulations?


4. Cost & Payment Terms:




What is your pricing structure, and are there volume discounts or bundled packages?
What are the payment terms, including advance payments, credit terms, and retention money?
Are there any hidden costs (e.g., shipping, installation, taxes)?
Do you offer flexible financing options or long-term contracts?


5. Risk Management & Liability:




What is your insurance coverage and liability in case of product failure or accidents?
Do you provide indemnity and warranty clauses?
What is your dispute resolution mechanism in case of contractual disagreements?

Next Steps: Please confirm if the above questionnaire works for QCS, or let me know if any changes are required.

If you need any further clarification or additional details, feel free to reach out.

Looking forward to your response!

Best regards,

Hi Shiv Sir,

I hope you are doing well!

It was a pleasure connecting with you today and gaining insights into Geco's current Intake-to-Procure process.

As discussed, we are happy to configure your current Intake-to-Procure requirements within Dice.

To proceed with the configuration, we would require the following details:

  *   Vendor Master
  *   Item Master
  *   PO Details
  *   Questionnaire for QCS (Quality Control & Safety)
Please find attached the Vendor Master, Product Master, and PO Details sheet for your reference. Kindly provide the necessary details in the same format.

Additionally, please let me know if the following QCS questionnaire works for you:

1. Product/Service Specifications & Quality:

  *   Can you provide sample test reports for material quality (e.g., strength, durability, safety)?
  *   Are your materials eco-friendly or sustainable, and do they meet green building standards?
  *   What is the expected lifespan and maintenance requirement of the product?
2. Construction Performance & Reliability:

  *   Have your products been used in similar construction projects? Can you provide case studies or references?
  *   What is the failure rate or defect ratio observed in real-world applications?
  *   Do you perform quality checks during manufacturing and pre-dispatch inspections?
3. Safety, Security & Compliance:

  *   Do your products comply with safety regulations (e.g., fire resistance, seismic safety, electrical safety)?
  *   Are they certified by relevant authorities (e.g., NABL, ISI, CE marking)?
  *   Do you provide Material Safety Data Sheets (MSDS) for hazardous materials?
  *   How do you ensure compliance with local building codes and environmental regulations?
4. Cost & Payment Terms:

  *   What is your pricing structure, and are there volume discounts or bundled packages?
  *   What are the payment terms, including advance payments, credit terms, and retention money?
  *   Are there any hidden costs (e.g., shipping, installation, taxes)?
  *   Do you offer flexible financing options or long-term contracts?
5. Risk Management & Liability:

  *   What is your insurance coverage and liability in case of product failure or accidents?
  *   Do you provide indemnity and warranty clauses?
  *   What is your dispute resolution mechanism in case of contractual disagreements?
Next Steps: Please confirm if the above questionnaire works for QCS, or let me know if any changes are required.

If you need any further clarification or additional details, feel free to reach out.

Looking forward to your response!

Best regards,

 wrote:




Dear Shiv,
It was great meeting you at ProcureTech! I enjoyed our conversation and am looking forward to our in-person meeting on
Monday at 2:00 PM in Sharjah to discuss how
Dice can enhance procurement operations at
GECO Mechanical & Electrical Ltd.
With $300M in annual spend, 6,000 POs, and 15,000 invoices, streamlining
supplier onboarding, validation, intake, e-negotiation, auctioning, PO acceptance, and invoicing is key.
Dice seamlessly integrates with
Procore and SAP ECC, enabling
real-time tracking, compliance, and automation for project-based procurement.
Industry leaders like GMR Group, Bajaj Electricals, and Tolaram Group use
Dice to streamline procurement and cut costs.
GMR improved
vendor onboarding by 30%,
Bajaj Electricals reduced
procurement cycles by 40%.We have also been working with Tolaram and GF Cory's in the Middle East.
Excited to explore how we can bring similar efficiencies to GECO. Let me know if there’s anything specific you’d like to cover. 
See you on Monday!
Regards,






Himanshi Joshi
Growth Consultant
+91-9630827366


Dice
www.dice.tech




































 

-- 




Ayush Srivastava
Pre Sales & Solutions Manager

On Mon, Mar 3, 2025 at 6:41 PM Ayush Srivastava <
ayush.srivastava@antrepriz.com> wrote:

> Hi Shiv Sir,
> I hope you are doing well!
>
> It was a pleasure connecting with you and gaining insights into *Geco's* current
> Intake-to-Procure process.
>
> As discussed, we are happy to configure your current Intake-to-Procure
> requirements within Dice.
>
> To proceed with the configuration, we would require the following details:
>
>    - *Vendor Master*
>    - *Item Master*
>    - *PO Details*
>    - *Questionnaire for QCS (Quality Control & Safety)*
>
> Please find attached the *Vendor Master, Product Master, and PO Details* sheet
> for your reference. Kindly provide the necessary details in the same format.
>
> Additionally, please let me know if the following QCS questionnaire works
> for you:
>
>
> *1. Product/Service Specifications & Quality:*
>
>
>    - *Can you provide sample test reports for material quality (e.g.,
>    strength, durability, safety)?*
>    - *Are your materials eco-friendly or sustainable, and do they meet
>    green building standards?*
>    - *What is the expected lifespan and maintenance requirement of the
>    product?*
>
>
> *2. Construction Performance & Reliability:*
>
>
>    *- Have your products been used in similar construction projects? Can
>    you provide case studies or references?- What is the failure rate or defect
>    ratio observed in real-world applications?- Do you perform quality checks
>    during manufacturing and pre-dispatch inspections?*
>
>
> *3. Safety, Security & Compliance:*
>
>
>    *- Do your products comply with safety regulations (e.g., fire
>    resistance, seismic safety, electrical safety)?- Are they certified by
>    relevant authorities (e.g., NABL, ISI, CE marking)?- Do you provide
>    Material Safety Data Sheets (MSDS) for hazardous materials?- How do you
>    ensure compliance with local building codes and environmental regulations?*
>
>
> *4. Cost & Payment Terms:*
>
>
>    *- What is your pricing structure, and are there volume discounts or
>    bundled packages?- What are the payment terms, including advance payments,
>    credit terms, and retention money?- Are there any hidden costs (e.g.,
>    shipping, installation, taxes)?- Do you offer flexible financing options or
>    long-term contracts?*
>
>
> *5. Risk Management & Liability:*
>
>
>    *- What is your insurance coverage and liability in case of product
>    failure or accidents?- Do you provide indemnity and warranty clauses?- What
>    is your dispute resolution mechanism in case of contractual disagreements?*
>
> *Next Steps*: Please confirm if the above questionnaire works for QCS, or
> let me know if any changes are required.
>
> If you need any further clarification or additional details, feel free to
> reach out.
>
> Looking forward to your response!
>
> Best regards,
>

Risk Management & Liability:What is your insurance coverage and liability in case of product failure or accidents?Do you provide indemnity and warranty clauses?What is your dispute resolution mechanism in case of contractual disagreements?Next Steps: Please confirm if the above questionnaire works for QCS, or let me know if any changes are required.If you need any further clarification or additional details, feel free to reach out.Looking forward to your response!Best regards,On Fri, Feb 28, 2025 at 6:02 PM Ayush Srivastava <ayush.srivastava@antrepriz.com> wrote:Hi Shiv Sir,I hope you are doing well!It was a pleasure connecting with you today and gaining insights into Geco's current Intake-to-Procure process.As discussed, we are happy to configure your current Intake-to-Procure requirements within Dice.To proceed with the configuration, we would require the following details:Vendor MasterItem MasterPO DetailsQuestionnaire for QCS (Quality Control & Safety)Please find attached the Vendor Master, Product Master, and PO Details sheet for your reference. subject: Re: Great meeting at  MIDDLE EAST PROCURETECH SUMMIT
body:
Hi Rupesh,

I hope you're doing well!

When we spoke at ProcureTech, we touched on how *PurchaseGPT* could be a
game-changer for Tata Steel International, but let’s dive deeper into how
it could truly revolutionize procurement for your team.

Imagine if your procurement process could think smarter, act faster, and
scale effortlessly. That's the power of *PurchaseGPT*.

   - *AI-Driven Vendor Selection*: PurchaseGPT uses data insights to
   automatically choose the best suppliers, ensuring cost savings and faster
   decision-making.
   - *Policy-Compliant Automation*: It embeds your procurement policies at
   every step, ensuring compliance without manual intervention.
   - *AI-Powered Spend Analytics*: With real-time spend analysis,
   PurchaseGPT offers insights that help optimize procurement strategies,
   drive savings, and prevent overspending.

[image: Thumbnail for the playlist PurchaseGPT v1.0]
<https://share.vidyard.com/watch/Bh54wNfEg3xKczEgQde2Gr?autoplay=1>
PurchaseGPT v1.0
<https://share.vidyard.com/watch/Bh54wNfEg3xKczEgQde2Gr?autoplay=1>

For Tata Steel, with your global supply chain and demand for resilience,
this level of automation could be a major competitive advantage. The
industry is evolving fast, and PurchaseGPT ensures you stay ahead, driving
both operational efficiency and cost-effectiveness.

Would *Thursday* *at 1 PM* work for a quick call to discuss how this can be
implemented for Tata Steel?

Looking forward to hearing your thoughts!

Best regards,


*Himanshi JoshiGrowth Consultant*

*+91-9630827366*

body:
Hi Bekir,

Ramadan Mubarak to you and your team!

Reflecting on our last conversation, I wanted to dive deeper into how Dice
can truly transform the way Americana Foods manages procurement and
spend—far beyond traditional solutions.

Imagine having an *AI-powered procurement assistant* that not only creates
purchase orders but also negotiates with vendors on your behalf. That's
what *PurchaseGPT* can bring to the table—driving cost efficiencies,
real-time spend visibility, and smarter decisions across the board.

On the other hand, *PayableGPT* redefines accounts payable by automating
invoice management, payment scheduling, and seamless ERP integration,
removing manual bottlenecks and enhancing cash flow predictability.

But here’s the game-changer:

   - With *Dice*, you’re not just automating processes—you’re empowering
   your team to make data-driven decisions.
   - Our *AI Audit Engine* ensures that every transaction is validated and
   compliant, preventing fraud and errors before they happen.

Would you be open to a quick 20-minute call this *Wednesday* *afternoon* to
explore how these capabilities can give Americana Foods an edge in the
market?

Looking forward to your thoughts!

Best regards,

Hi Sanjay,

Thanks for your time on the call today.

The use case revolves around efficiently distinguishing between business-related visits and personal visits throughout the day, without the need for repeatedly starting and stopping journey tracking.

Our proposed solution addresses this challenge by introducing a Check-In functionality at each client location. This allows users to mark business visits seamlessly while providing the option to tag deviations for personal trips, ensuring these are excluded from business visits.

This approach offers enhanced compliance and visibility by capturing end-to-end information on client interactions and visit patterns. Additionally, with our solution, all visit data can be seamlessly synced with your CRM, creating a unified and accurate view of client engagements

Here's a quick case study for your reference on the similar use case.

Hi Manohar / Sonam,

Thanks for your time and support with the refresher demo today.

Kindly find the queries from the ERP team that Kashif mentioned during our meeting today for your review and feedback.


Questionnaire for Expense Tracking System:



1. Does Expense Tracking System’s APIs work two-way integration? Does it support SOAP based web services or REST API protocols.



2. Any prior experience for Integration with Oracle E-Business Suite (ERP)? Any case study with Oracle Integration Cloud (OIC).



3. Few additional attributes are required to generate payable invoices in EBS (e.g., Org ID, Vendor ID, Vendor Site ID),

     Kindly confirm in case Expense Tracking System can accommodate new attributes in GUI as well as in APIs.



4. Is there any specific API endpoint for uploading or retrieving attachments?



5. Is it possible to share detailed API documentation for the Expense Tracking System, including supported endpoints, request/response formats, and payload examples?



6. What authentication mechanisms APIs supports (e.g., OAuth 2.0, API keys)?



7. Is there any IP whitelisting option or additional security requirements that needs to be configured?



8. What is the API payload size and call limits for API requests?



9. Is there any maximum size limit for attachments and what are the supported formats (e.g., PDF, JPEG, PNG)?



10. How integration errors are communicated (e.g., error codes, response messages)?



11. Does APIs support retry mechanisms for failed transactions?



12. Is there a sandbox or test environment we can use for integration testing?



13. What format and data structure is required for sending batch element entries (e.g., JSON, XML)?



14. Is there a unique identifier for each element entry to ensure no duplicate processing in Oracle?



15. Is there an acknowledgment mechanism to confirm successful receipt of processed results in Expense Tracking System?



16. Does Expense Tracking Software APIs support attachments (e.g., expense receipts) along with batch entries?

        If yes, how are these attachments linked to a specific transaction?



17. How does Expense Tracking System handle invoice status updates sent back from Oracle?



18. How frequently should the payment status updates be sent to Expense Tracking System (real-time, scheduled batches)?



19. Is there a way to log or track changes for audit purposes?



20. Please outline the expected response times (latency) and any defined timeouts for the Expense Tracking System APIs.



21. How does API versioning and backward compatibility is being handled.



22. Does ExTS supports bulk upload to Employee Master through Excel / CSV file.



23. Does ExTS supports bulk upload through excel / CSV file to other masters like Expense Type / Account Codes etc.

Hi Sanjay,


Thanks for your time on the call today. 





The use case revolves around efficiently distinguishing between business-related visits and personal visits throughout the day, without the need for repeatedly starting and stopping journey tracking.
Our proposed solution addresses this challenge by introducing a 
Check-In functionality at each client location. This allows users to mark business visits seamlessly while providing the option to tag deviations for personal trips, ensuring these are excluded from business visits.
This approach offers enhanced compliance and visibility by capturing end-to-end information on client interactions and visit patterns. Additionally, with our solution, all visit data can be seamlessly synced with your CRM, creating a unified
 and accurate view of client engagements
Here's a quick case study for your reference on the similar use case.

Questionnaire for Expense Tracking System:

 

1. Does Expense Tracking System’s APIs work two-way integration? Does it support SOAP based web services or REST API protocols.

 

2. Any prior experience for Integration with Oracle E-Business Suite (ERP)? Any case study with Oracle Integration Cloud (OIC).

     Kindly confirm in case Expense Tracking System can accommodate new attributes in GUI as well as in APIs.

              

4. Is there any specific API endpoint for uploading or retrieving attachments?

 

5. Is it possible to share detailed API documentation for the Expense Tracking System, including supported endpoints, request/response formats, and payload examples?

 

6. What authentication mechanisms APIs supports (e.g., OAuth 2.0, API keys)?

 

7. Is there any IP whitelisting option or additional security requirements that needs to be configured?

 

8. What is the API payload size and call limits for API requests?

 

9. Is there any maximum size limit for attachments and what are the supported formats (e.g., PDF, JPEG, PNG)?

 

10. How integration errors are communicated (e.g., error codes, response messages)?

 

11. Does APIs support retry mechanisms for failed transactions?

 

12. Is there a sandbox or test environment we can use for integration testing?

 

13. What format and data structure is required for sending batch element entries (e.g., JSON, XML)?

 

14. Is there a unique identifier for each element entry to ensure no duplicate processing in Oracle?

 

15. Is there an acknowledgment mechanism to confirm successful receipt of processed results in Expense Tracking System?

 

16. Does Expense Tracking Software APIs support attachments (e.g., expense receipts) along with batch entries?

        If yes, how are these attachments linked to a specific transaction?

              

17. How does Expense Tracking System handle invoice status updates sent back from Oracle?

 

18. How frequently should the payment status updates be sent to Expense Tracking System (real-time, scheduled batches)?

 

19. Is there a way to log or track changes for audit purposes?

 

20. Please outline the expected response times (latency) and any defined timeouts for the Expense Tracking System APIs.

 

21. How does API versioning and backward compatibility is being handled.

body:
Hi Beena,

I hope you're doing well and Ramadan Mubarak to you and your team!

Please find attached the commercial proposal as requested, which includes
the following components:

   - *No of Petty Cash Users ~ *50
   - *No of invoices ~ 16,000* across all outlets and the factory
   - Detailed pricing and breakdown for each component

We would appreciate the opportunity to discuss the proposal and provide a
commercial rundown tomorrow. Please let me know if around *12 PM GST *works
for you.

Looking forward to your feedback.

Best regards,


*Himanshi JoshiGrowth Consultant*

*+91-9630827366*

Dice
www.dice.tech

[image: https://www.linkedin.com/in/himanshi-joshi-39ba12202/]
<https://www.linkedin.com/in/himanshi-joshi-39ba12202/>

<https://dice.tech/>

subject: Re: Great Meeting You at Middle East ProcureTech Summit – Let’s Continue the Conversation
body:
Hi Shiv Sir,
I hope you are doing well!

It was a pleasure connecting with you and gaining insights into
*Geco's* current
Intake-to-Procure process.

As discussed, we are happy to configure your current Intake-to-Procure
requirements within Dice.

To proceed with the configuration, we would require the following details:

   - *Vendor Master*
   - *Item Master*
   - *PO Details*
   - *Questionnaire for QCS (Quality Control & Safety)*

Please find attached the *Vendor Master, Product Master, and PO Details* sheet
for your reference. Kindly provide the necessary details in the same format.

Additionally, please let me know if the following QCS questionnaire works
for you:


*1. Product/Service Specifications & Quality:*


   - *Can you provide sample test reports for material quality (e.g.,
   strength, durability, safety)?*
   - *Are your materials eco-friendly or sustainable, and do they meet
   green building standards?*
   - *What is the expected lifespan and maintenance requirement of the
   product?*


*2. Construction Performance & Reliability:*


   *- Have your products been used in similar construction projects? Can
   you provide case studies or references?- What is the failure rate or defect
   ratio observed in real-world applications?- Do you perform quality checks
   during manufacturing and pre-dispatch inspections?*


*3. Safety, Security & Compliance:*


   *- Do your products comply with safety regulations (e.g., fire
   resistance, seismic safety, electrical safety)?- Are they certified by
   relevant authorities (e.g., NABL, ISI, CE marking)?- Do you provide
   Material Safety Data Sheets (MSDS) for hazardous materials?- How do you
   ensure compliance with local building codes and environmental regulations?*


*4. Cost & Payment Terms:*


   *- What is your pricing structure, and are there volume discounts or
   bundled packages?- What are the payment terms, including advance payments,
   credit terms, and retention money?- Are there any hidden costs (e.g.,
   shipping, installation, taxes)?- Do you offer flexible financing options or
   long-term contracts?*


*5. Risk Management & Liability:*


   *- What is your insurance coverage and liability in case of product
   failure or accidents?- Do you provide indemnity and warranty clauses?- What
   is your dispute resolution mechanism in case of contractual disagreements?*

*Next Steps*: Please confirm if the above questionnaire works for QCS, or
let me know if any changes are required.

If you need any further clarification or additional details, feel free to
reach out.

Looking forward to your response!

Best regards,

On Thu, 16 Jan 2025 at 5:34 PM, Sonam Khubchandani <sonam@dice.tech> wrote:



Hi Sanjay,


Thanks for your time on the call today. 





The use case revolves around efficiently distinguishing between business-related visits and personal visits throughout the day, without the need for repeatedly starting and stopping journey tracking.
Our proposed solution addresses this challenge by introducing a 
Check-In functionality at each client location. This allows users to mark business visits seamlessly while providing the option to tag deviations for personal trips, ensuring these are excluded from business visits.
This approach offers enhanced compliance and visibility by capturing end-to-end information on client interactions and visit patterns. Additionally, with our solution, all visit data can be seamlessly synced with your CRM, creating a unified
 and accurate view of client engagements
Here's a quick case study for your reference on the similar use case.

Questionnaire for Expense Tracking System:

 

1. Does Expense Tracking System’s APIs work two-way integration? Does it support SOAP based web services or REST API protocols.

 

2. Any prior experience for Integration with Oracle E-Business Suite (ERP)? Any case study with Oracle Integration Cloud (OIC).

 

3. Few additional attributes are required to generate payable invoices in EBS (e.g., Org ID, Vendor ID, Vendor Site ID),

     Kindly confirm in case Expense Tracking System can accommodate new attributes in GUI as well as in APIs.

              

4. Is there any specific API endpoint for uploading or retrieving attachments?

 

5. Is it possible to share detailed API documentation for the Expense Tracking System, including supported endpoints, request/response formats, and payload examples?

 

6. What authentication mechanisms APIs supports (e.g., OAuth 2.0, API keys)?

 

7. Is there any IP whitelisting option or additional security requirements that needs to be configured?

 

8. What is the API payload size and call limits for API requests?

 

9. Is there any maximum size limit for attachments and what are the supported formats (e.g., PDF, JPEG, PNG)?

 

10. How integration errors are communicated (e.g., error codes, response messages)?

 

11. Does APIs support retry mechanisms for failed transactions?

 

12. Is there a sandbox or test environment we can use for integration testing?

 

13. What format and data structure is required for sending batch element entries (e.g., JSON, XML)?

 

14. Is there a unique identifier for each element entry to ensure no duplicate processing in Oracle?

 

15. Is there an acknowledgment mechanism to confirm successful receipt of processed results in Expense Tracking System?

 

16. Does Expense Tracking Software APIs support attachments (e.g., expense receipts) along with batch entries?

        If yes, how are these attachments linked to a specific transaction?

              

17. How does Expense Tracking System handle invoice status updates sent back from Oracle?

 

18. How frequently should the payment status updates be sent to Expense Tracking System (real-time, scheduled batches)?

 

19. Is there a way to log or track changes for audit purposes?

 

20. Please outline the expected response times (latency) and any defined timeouts for the Expense Tracking System APIs.

 

21. How does API versioning and backward compatibility is being handled.

 

22. Does ExTS supports bulk upload to Employee Master through Excel / CSV file.

 

23. Does ExTS supports bulk upload through excel / CSV file to other masters like Expense Type / Account Codes etc.

The use case revolves around efficiently distinguishing between business-related visits and personal visits throughout the day, without the need for repeatedly starting and stopping journey tracking.

This approach offers enhanced compliance and visibility by capturing end-to-end information on client interactions and visit patterns. Additionally, with our solution, all visit data can be seamlessly synced with your CRM, creating a unified
 and accurate view of client engagements

Hi Manohar / Sonam,




Greetings again.




Thanks for your time and support with the refresher demo today.




Kindly find the queries from the ERP team that Kashif mentioned during our meeting today for your review and feedback.




Questionnaire for Expense Tracking System:

 

1. Does Expense Tracking System’s APIs work two-way integration? Does it support SOAP based web services or REST API protocols.

 

2. Any prior experience for Integration with Oracle E-Business Suite (ERP)? Any case study with Oracle Integration Cloud (OIC).

 

3. Few additional attributes are required to generate payable invoices in EBS (e.g., Org ID, Vendor ID, Vendor Site ID),

     Kindly confirm in case Expense Tracking System can accommodate new attributes in GUI as well as in APIs.

              

4. Is there any specific API endpoint for uploading or retrieving attachments?

 

5. Is it possible to share detailed API documentation for the Expense Tracking System, including supported endpoints, request/response formats, and payload examples?

 

6. What authentication mechanisms APIs supports (e.g., OAuth 2.0, API keys)?

 

7. Is there any IP whitelisting option or additional security requirements that needs to be configured?

 

8. What is the API payload size and call limits for API requests?

 

9. Is there any maximum size limit for attachments and what are the supported formats (e.g., PDF, JPEG, PNG)?

 

10. How integration errors are communicated (e.g., error codes, response messages)?

 

11. Does APIs support retry mechanisms for failed transactions?

 

12. Is there a sandbox or test environment we can use for integration testing?

 

13. What format and data structure is required for sending batch element entries (e.g., JSON, XML)?

 

14. Is there a unique identifier for each element entry to ensure no duplicate processing in Oracle?

 

15. Is there an acknowledgment mechanism to confirm successful receipt of processed results in Expense Tracking System?

 

16. Does Expense Tracking Software APIs support attachments (e.g., expense receipts) along with batch entries?

        If yes, how are these attachments linked to a specific transaction?

              

17. How does Expense Tracking System handle invoice status updates sent back from Oracle?

 

18. How frequently should the payment status updates be sent to Expense Tracking System (real-time, scheduled batches)?

 

19. Is there a way to log or track changes for audit purposes?

 

20. Please outline the expected response times (latency) and any defined timeouts for the Expense Tracking System APIs.

 

21. How does API versioning and backward compatibility is being handled.

 

22. Does ExTS supports bulk upload to Employee Master through Excel / CSV file.

 

23. Does ExTS supports bulk upload through excel / CSV file to other masters like Expense Type / Account Codes etc.

subject: Re: Enhancing Petty Cash Management at PizzaExpress
body:
Hi Neha,

I hope you are having a great start to the week.

It seems we missed the opportunity to connect in person during our recent 
visit, so I wanted to share how Dice can help streamline petty cash 
management at PizzaExpress. Multi-outlet chains like yours often face 
challenges with visibility, manual reconciliations, and policy compliance, 
leading to inefficiencies and cash leakages.

Here’s how Dice can make a difference:

   - *Real-time petty cash tracking* across all outlets 
   - *Automated approvals & policy enforcement* to prevent leakages 
   - *Seamless ERP integration* for effortless reconciliation 
   - *AI-driven fraud detection* for financial control 

We’re currently working with *Bikanervala*, managing petty cash processes 
across all 26 of their stores. By implementing our solution, they’ve gained 
better visibility, reduced manual efforts, and ensured stronger policy 
compliance, leading to significant improvements in financial control.

We’ve also helped companies like *Haldiram* reduce processing time by 60% 
and payment errors by 40%.

Would you be available for a quick call this Thursday to discuss how Dice 
can bring similar efficiency to PizzaExpress? Let me know a time that works 
for you.

Best regards,


*Himanshi JoshiGrowth Consultant*

*+91-9630827366*

Dice
www.dice.tech

[image: https://www.linkedin.com/in/himanshi-joshi-39ba12202/] 
<https://www.linkedin.com/in/himanshi-joshi-39ba12202/>

<https://dice.tech/>

subject: Re: Optimizing Indirect Spend at Lafarge Emirates Cement with AI
body:
Dear Sonam

Based on the information and current practices we've shared, could you
please develop a proposal outlining how we can optimize automation?
Specifically, we'd like to explore the following phases:

Phase 1
* Auto-generate and send POs for approval if an identical PO was created
within the last 3 months.
* For all other cases, send the PO for approval once the AI agent receives
an email confirmation from the supplier.

Phase 2:
* * Implement automatic RFQ generation, TE preparation, and draft PO
creation for approval for these items.

We appreciate your efforts in helping us streamline our procurement process.


Thanks & Regards,


*Anil KUMAR | **Procurement Manager*

*E&C and Maint. **Services.** | **LEC & Geocycle*

*Lafarge Emirates Cement LLC **- *A member of Holcim Group

Idhn,Habhab ,Fujairah,UAE

P.O.Box: 29966, Ras Al Khaimah - UAE

Tel (+971) (7) 2044702 / (+971) (7) 2044888, Ext- 404

Mobile (+971) (55) 7008397 - Fax (+971) (7) 2448620

Email : *anil.kumar@*lafargeholcim.com <john.sample@lafargeholcim.com>

*www.lafarge.ae <http://www.lafarge.ae/>* / *www.holcim.com
<http://www.lafargeholcim.com/>*

On Mon, Mar 3, 2025 at 2:28 PM Sonam Khubchandani <sonam@dice.tech> wrote:

> Hi Anil & Sajin,
>
> Thanks for having us at your office.
>
> Following our discussion, we’ve outlined the key procurement uuse
> cases identified during our discussion and how an AI Agentic approach can
> optimize them.
>
> *Repeatable Purchases* – The current process involves an end-user raising
> a Purchase Requisition (PR), which, post-approval, moves to the Procurement
> team. The team conducts the RFQ, followed by technical and commercial
> evaluations, eventually leading to a *blanket purchase order*.
>
>    - Here's we can add a layer of Catalogue based E-Procurement on top of
>    Purchase Requisition creation in Oracle as a single door intake process.
>
> *AI Agents for Process Improvements*
>
>    - *Lower-Value Purchases *– These transactions require significant
>    manual intervention, often delaying procurement cycles. Our AI-driven
>    procurement automation solution can streamline this by handling the *RFQ
>    process autonomously* while keeping you in the loop for key decision
>    points. This reduces procurement overhead while ensuring efficiency,
>    compliance, and cost optimization.
>
> To dive deeper into the *second use case*, we envision an AI-driven
> workflow where:
>
>    - The AI Agent *identifies relevant suppliers* from the master
>    database based on category, pricing, and past transactions.
>    - It then *generates and sends RFQs*, tracks responses, and *negotiates
>    autonomously* based on predefined parameters and market insights.
>    - Once optimal supplier terms are reached, the AI Agent *compiles a
>    comparative analysis* and drafts a *Purchase Order (PO) for the L1
>    supplier*.
>    - The system ensures full auditability and seamless integration into
>    your existing ERP and approval workflows.
>
> *AI Agents for Spend Analytics*
>
>
>    - Agents to collect data from Jagger, Oracle Fusion & other DMS
>    deployed at Lafarge.
>    - The data will get stored in Vector Database
>    - User will be able to query & the database & AI Agent should create
>    the chart/graphs in real-time.
>
> Can we connect *sometime this week* to deep dive on these use cases?
>
> @Himanshi Joshi <himanshi.joshi@dice.tech>, kindly coordinate with Anil
> to get the preferred time slot for the AI Agent discussion.
> --
> Sonam
> +91 704 569 6971 /+971 56 982 3620
> dice.tech
>
>

Dear SonamBased on the information and current practices we've shared, could you please develop a proposal outlining how we can optimize automation?Specifically, we'd like to explore the following phases:Phase 1* Auto-generate and send POs for approval if an identical PO was created within the last 3 months.* For all other cases, send the PO for approval once the AI agent receives an email confirmation from the supplier.Phase 2:* * Implement automatic RFQ generation, TE preparation, and draft PO creation for approval for these items.We appreciate your efforts in helping us streamline our procurement process.Thanks &
Regards,

 On Mon, Mar 3, 2025 at 2:28 PM Sonam Khubchandani <sonam@dice.tech> wrote:Hi Anil & Sajin,Thanks for having us at your office. Following our discussion, we’ve outlined the key procurement uuse cases identified during our discussion and how an AI Agentic approach can optimize them. Repeatable Purchases – The current process involves an end-user raising a Purchase Requisition (PR), which, post-approval, moves to the Procurement team. The team conducts the RFQ, followed by technical and commercial evaluations, eventually leading to a blanket purchase order.Here's we can add a layer of Catalogue based E-Procurement on top of Purchase Requisition creation in Oracle as a single door intake process. AI Agents for Process ImprovementsLower-Value Purchases – These transactions require significant manual intervention, often delaying procurement cycles. Our AI-driven procurement automation solution can streamline this by handling the RFQ process autonomously while keeping you in the loop for key decision points. This reduces procurement overhead while ensuring efficiency, compliance, and cost optimization.To dive deeper into the second use case, we envision an AI-driven workflow where:The AI Agent identifies relevant suppliers from the master database based on category, pricing, and past transactions.It then generates and sends RFQs, tracks responses, and negotiates autonomously based on predefined parameters and market insights.Once optimal supplier terms are reached, the AI Agent compiles a comparative analysis and drafts a Purchase Order (PO) for the L1 supplier.The system ensures full auditability and seamless integration into your existing ERP and approval workflows.AI Agents for Spend AnalyticsAgents to collect data from Jagger, Oracle Fusion & other DMS deployed at Lafarge. The data will get stored in Vector DatabaseUser will be able to query & the database & AI Agent should create the chart/graphs in real-time.  Can we connect sometime this week to deep dive on these use cases?@Himanshi Joshi, kindly coordinate with Anil to get the preferred time slot for the AI Agent discussion. --Sonam+91 704 569 6971 /+971 56 982 3620dice.techOn Thu, Feb 20, 2025 at 1:27 PM Anil Kumar GOPALAKRISHNAN <anil.kumar@lafargeholcim.com> wrote:Dear HimanshiYou may please block the calendar at 3pm or 5pmThanks &

> deviations for personal trips, ensuring these are excluded from business
> visits.

The use case revolves around efficiently distinguishing between business-related visits and personal visits throughout the day, without the need for repeatedly starting and stopping journey tracking.
Our proposed solution addresses this challenge by introducing a 
Check-In functionality at each client location. This allows users to mark business visits seamlessly while providing the option to tag deviations for personal trips, ensuring these are excluded from business visits.
This approach offers enhanced compliance and visibility by capturing end-to-end information on client interactions and visit patterns. Additionally, with our solution, all visit data can be seamlessly synced with your CRM, creating a unified
 and accurate view of client engagements

subject: Re: Optimizing Indirect Spend at Lafarge Emirates Cement with AI
body:
Hi Anil & Sajin,

Thanks for having us at your office.

Following our discussion, we’ve outlined the key procurement uuse
cases identified during our discussion and how an AI Agentic approach can
optimize them.

*Repeatable Purchases* – The current process involves an end-user raising a
Purchase Requisition (PR), which, post-approval, moves to the Procurement
team. The team conducts the RFQ, followed by technical and commercial
evaluations, eventually leading to a *blanket purchase order*.

   - Here's we can add a layer of Catalogue based E-Procurement on top of
   Purchase Requisition creation in Oracle as a single door intake process.

*AI Agents for Process Improvements*

   - *Lower-Value Purchases *– These transactions require significant
   manual intervention, often delaying procurement cycles. Our AI-driven
   procurement automation solution can streamline this by handling the *RFQ
   process autonomously* while keeping you in the loop for key decision
   points. This reduces procurement overhead while ensuring efficiency,
   compliance, and cost optimization.

To dive deeper into the *second use case*, we envision an AI-driven
workflow where:

   - The AI Agent *identifies relevant suppliers* from the master database
   based on category, pricing, and past transactions.
   - It then *generates and sends RFQs*, tracks responses, and *negotiates
   autonomously* based on predefined parameters and market insights.
   - Once optimal supplier terms are reached, the AI Agent *compiles a
   comparative analysis* and drafts a *Purchase Order (PO) for the L1
   supplier*.
   - The system ensures full auditability and seamless integration into
   your existing ERP and approval workflows.

*AI Agents for Spend Analytics*


   - Agents to collect data from Jagger, Oracle Fusion & other DMS deployed
   at Lafarge.
   - The data will get stored in Vector Database
   - User will be able to query & the database & AI Agent should create the
   chart/graphs in real-time.

Can we connect *sometime this week* to deep dive on these use cases?

@Himanshi Joshi <himanshi.joshi@dice.tech>, kindly coordinate with Anil to
get the preferred time slot for the AI Agent discussion.
--
Sonam
+91 704 569 6971 /+971 56 982 3620
dice.tech

subject: Important Notice on Late Coming and Absenteeism
body:
Hi Everyone,

Maintaining discipline in attendance and punctuality is essential for our
collective success. Effective March 2025, any instances of late arrivals or
unapproved absences will result in salary deductions as per company policy
and will be adjusted in the payroll accordingly.

While we understand that occasional emergencies may arise, timely
communication with your manager is expected. However, repeated lateness or
absenteeism will no longer be tolerated, as it disrupts workflow and
impacts team productivity.

We appreciate your cooperation and commitment to fostering a professional
and accountable work environment.

Thanks & Regards,


*Jeemit ChakmaManager - People & Culture*

+91 7356638988

Dice
www.dice.tech

[image: https://www.linkedin.com/in/jeemit-chakma-610639150/]
<https://www.linkedin.com/in/jeemit-chakma-610639150/>

<http://www.dice.tech>

Please carefully check the e-mail for phishing indicators before clicking or opening anything. Guidance on how to identify and report phishing e-mails you can find on We@GF.<https://we-at-gf.georgfischer.com/content/page/633c28f9426e0d2ebb9851a1>



Hi Sanjay Sir,

I also wanted to let you know that the vendors currently listed are dummy vendors, which allows you to check in from any location.

To ensure the check-in feature works accurately, we would need a list of a few of your actual vendors along with their latitude and longitude. We can then configure these vendors within the system and enable Geo-Fencing, so users can only check in within a specified range of the vendor’s location.

Looking forward to your response.

Thank you!

Best regards,

On Thu, Feb 27, 2025 at 2:07 PM Ayush Srivastava <ayush.srivastava@antrepriz.com<mailto:ayush.srivastava@antrepriz.com>> wrote:
Hi Sanjay Sir,

Greetings of the day!

As discussed, please let me know if we can connect on a call today or tomorrow to sort out the check-in functionality.

To ensure this feature to works appropriately, we would need the list of few of your vendors along with their latitude and longitude. Once we receive this information, we’ll be happy to configure the functionality accordingly.

I look forward to your response.

Best regards,

On Fri, Feb 21, 2025 at 4:49 PM Ayush Srivastava <ayush.srivastava@antrepriz.com<mailto:ayush.srivastava@antrepriz.com>> wrote:
Hi Sanjay Sir,

Thank you for taking the time to connect with us today. I truly appreciate your patience and valuable feedback, and it was a pleasure interacting with you.

Summary of Discussion:

During our call today, we covered several key points and addressed the challenges faced by your team:

  *   Check-In Issue Resolved:
     *   We have successfully resolved the check-in issue that you and your team encountered earlier.
  *   Odometer Reading Feature:
     *   We discussed the odometer reading feature and its relevance for tracking mileage.
     *   Please confirm if you would like to retain or disable this feature for your team. We can configure it according to your preference.
  *   Differentiation Between Business & Personal Trips:
     *   The application also allows users to differentiate between business and personal trips effortlessly.
     *   This feature ensures accurate expense tracking and reporting, enhancing visibility and compliance with company policies.
  *   Adding New Vendors from the App:
     *   We also discussed that if a new vendor is not listed in the existing vendor check-in list, users should have the option to add the vendor directly from the app.
     *   This enhancement will simplify the process and enhance the overall user experience. We have noted your feedback and are prepared to work on this to better meet your needs.

In the meantime, @Farrell, Ian<mailto:ian.farrell@georgfischer.com> , @Fatima, Hina<mailto:hina.fatima@georgfischer.com> and @Nambiar, Satish<mailto:satish.nambiar@georgfischer.com> - I kindly request you to try out the feature once again and provide your feedback.

Let me know if you have any questions.

Thank you

On Mon, Feb 17, 2025 at 5:52 PM Agheda, Sanjay <sanjay.agheda@georgfischer.com<mailto:sanjay.agheda@georgfischer.com>> wrote:

Dear All,

I have installed the app and helped Marilyn to install the same and will share the PDF documents for their reference on how to use the app. And then will give our feedback.

Also, regarding meeting Sonam and Manohar on 20 or 21 February, will check with the team and update which day is feasible to meet them in person.

Thanks.


Best regards

Hi Sanjay,

Thanks for your time on the call today.

The use case revolves around efficiently distinguishing between business-related visits and personal visits throughout the day, without the need for repeatedly starting and stopping journey tracking.

Our proposed solution addresses this challenge by introducing a Check-In functionality at each client location. This allows users to mark business visits seamlessly while providing the option to tag deviations for personal trips, ensuring these are excluded from business visits.

This approach offers enhanced compliance and visibility by capturing end-to-end information on client interactions and visit patterns. Additionally, with our solution, all visit data can be seamlessly synced with your CRM, creating a unified and accurate view of client engagements

Here's a quick case study for your reference on the similar use case.

Hi Manohar / Sonam,

Greetings again.

Thanks for your time and support with the refresher demo today.

Kindly find the queries from the ERP team that Kashif mentioned during our meeting today for your review and feedback.


Questionnaire for Expense Tracking System:



1. Does Expense Tracking System’s APIs work two-way integration? Does it support SOAP based web services or REST API protocols.



2. Any prior experience for Integration with Oracle E-Business Suite (ERP)? Any case study with Oracle Integration Cloud (OIC).



3. Few additional attributes are required to generate payable invoices in EBS (e.g., Org ID, Vendor ID, Vendor Site ID),

     Kindly confirm in case Expense Tracking System can accommodate new attributes in GUI as well as in APIs.



4. Is there any specific API endpoint for uploading or retrieving attachments?



5. Is it possible to share detailed API documentation for the Expense Tracking System, including supported endpoints, request/response formats, and payload examples?



6. What authentication mechanisms APIs supports (e.g., OAuth 2.0, API keys)?



7. Is there any IP whitelisting option or additional security requirements that needs to be configured?



8. What is the API payload size and call limits for API requests?



9. Is there any maximum size limit for attachments and what are the supported formats (e.g., PDF, JPEG, PNG)?



10. How integration errors are communicated (e.g., error codes, response messages)?



11. Does APIs support retry mechanisms for failed transactions?



12. Is there a sandbox or test environment we can use for integration testing?



13. What format and data structure is required for sending batch element entries (e.g., JSON, XML)?



14. Is there a unique identifier for each element entry to ensure no duplicate processing in Oracle?



15. Is there an acknowledgment mechanism to confirm successful receipt of processed results in Expense Tracking System?



16. Does Expense Tracking Software APIs support attachments (e.g., expense receipts) along with batch entries?

        If yes, how are these attachments linked to a specific transaction?



17. How does Expense Tracking System handle invoice status updates sent back from Oracle?



18. How frequently should the payment status updates be sent to Expense Tracking System (real-time, scheduled batches)?



19. Is there a way to log or track changes for audit purposes?



20. Please outline the expected response times (latency) and any defined timeouts for the Expense Tracking System APIs.



21. How does API versioning and backward compatibility is being handled.



22. Does ExTS supports bulk upload to Employee Master through Excel / CSV file.



23. Does ExTS supports bulk upload through excel / CSV file to other masters like Expense Type / Account Codes etc.

Hi Sanjay,


Thanks for your time on the call today. 





The use case revolves around efficiently distinguishing between business-related visits and personal visits throughout the day, without the need for repeatedly starting and stopping journey tracking.
Our proposed solution addresses this challenge by introducing a 
Check-In functionality at each client location. This allows users to mark business visits seamlessly while providing the option to tag deviations for personal trips, ensuring these are excluded from business visits.
This approach offers enhanced compliance and visibility by capturing end-to-end information on client interactions and visit patterns. Additionally, with our solution, all visit data can be seamlessly synced with your CRM, creating a unified
 and accurate view of client engagements
Here's a quick case study for your reference on the similar use case.

Questionnaire for Expense Tracking System:

 

1. Does Expense Tracking System’s APIs work two-way integration? Does it support SOAP based web services or REST API protocols.

 

2. Any prior experience for Integration with Oracle E-Business Suite (ERP)? Any case study with Oracle Integration Cloud (OIC).

 

3. Few additional attributes are required to generate payable invoices in EBS (e.g., Org ID, Vendor ID, Vendor Site ID),

     Kindly confirm in case Expense Tracking System can accommodate new attributes in GUI as well as in APIs.

              

4. Is there any specific API endpoint for uploading or retrieving attachments?

 

5. Is it possible to share detailed API documentation for the Expense Tracking System, including supported endpoints, request/response formats, and payload examples?

 

6. What authentication mechanisms APIs supports (e.g., OAuth 2.0, API keys)?

 

7. Is there any IP whitelisting option or additional security requirements that needs to be configured?

 

8. What is the API payload size and call limits for API requests?

 

9. Is there any maximum size limit for attachments and what are the supported formats (e.g., PDF, JPEG, PNG)?

 

10. How integration errors are communicated (e.g., error codes, response messages)?

 

11. Does APIs support retry mechanisms for failed transactions?

 

12. Is there a sandbox or test environment we can use for integration testing?

 

13. What format and data structure is required for sending batch element entries (e.g., JSON, XML)?

 

14. Is there a unique identifier for each element entry to ensure no duplicate processing in Oracle?

 

15. Is there an acknowledgment mechanism to confirm successful receipt of processed results in Expense Tracking System?

 

16. Does Expense Tracking Software APIs support attachments (e.g., expense receipts) along with batch entries?

        If yes, how are these attachments linked to a specific transaction?

              

17. How does Expense Tracking System handle invoice status updates sent back from Oracle?

 

18. How frequently should the payment status updates be sent to Expense Tracking System (real-time, scheduled batches)?

 

19. Is there a way to log or track changes for audit purposes?

 

20. Please outline the expected response times (latency) and any defined timeouts for the Expense Tracking System APIs.

 

21. How does API versioning and backward compatibility is being handled.

 

22. Does ExTS supports bulk upload to Employee Master through Excel / CSV file.

 

23. Does ExTS supports bulk upload through excel / CSV file to other masters like Expense Type / Account Codes etc.

subject: Re: Great Meeting You at Middle East ProcureTech Summit – Let’s Continue the Conversation
body:
Hi Shiv Sir,

I hope you are doing well!

It was a pleasure connecting with you today and gaining insights into
*Geco's* current Intake-to-Procure process.

As discussed, we are happy to configure your current Intake-to-Procure
requirements within Dice.

To proceed with the configuration, we would require the following details:

   - *Vendor Master*
   - *Item Master*
   - *PO Details*
   - *Questionnaire for QCS (Quality Control & Safety)*

Please find attached the *Vendor Master, Product Master, and PO Details*
sheet for your reference. Kindly provide the necessary details in the same
format.

Additionally, please let me know if the following QCS questionnaire works
for you:


*1. Product/Service Specifications & Quality:*


   - *Can you provide sample test reports for material quality (e.g.,
   strength, durability, safety)?*
   - *Are your materials eco-friendly or sustainable, and do they meet
   green building standards?*
   - *What is the expected lifespan and maintenance requirement of the
   product?*


*2. Construction Performance & Reliability:*


   *- Have your products been used in similar construction projects? Can
   you provide case studies or references?- What is the failure rate or defect
   ratio observed in real-world applications?- Do you perform quality checks
   during manufacturing and pre-dispatch inspections?*


*3. Safety, Security & Compliance:*


   *- Do your products comply with safety regulations (e.g., fire
   resistance, seismic safety, electrical safety)?- Are they certified by
   relevant authorities (e.g., NABL, ISI, CE marking)?- Do you provide
   Material Safety Data Sheets (MSDS) for hazardous materials?- How do you
   ensure compliance with local building codes and environmental regulations?*


*4. Cost & Payment Terms:*


   *- What is your pricing structure, and are there volume discounts or
   bundled packages?- What are the payment terms, including advance payments,
   credit terms, and retention money?- Are there any hidden costs (e.g.,
   shipping, installation, taxes)?- Do you offer flexible financing options or
   long-term contracts?*


*5. Risk Management & Liability:*


   *- What is your insurance coverage and liability in case of product
   failure or accidents?- Do you provide indemnity and warranty clauses?- What
   is your dispute resolution mechanism in case of contractual disagreements?*

*Next Steps*: Please confirm if the above questionnaire works for QCS, or
let me know if any changes are required.

If you need any further clarification or additional details, feel free to
reach out.

Looking forward to your response!

Best regards,

subject: Fwd: All Modules || Reports | Templates | Feature List
body:
---------- Forwarded message ---------
From: Ekta Singh <ekta.singh@antrepriz.com>
Date: Thu, Oct 24, 2024 at 1:11 PM
Subject: All Modules || Reports | Templates | Feature List
To: Abhishek Chaturvedi <abhishek.chaturvedi@antrepriz.com>, Sales Team <
team.sales@antrepriz.com>, Enterprise Sales <sales@antrepriz.com>
Cc: Sonam Khubchandani <sonam@antrepriz.com>, Shankar Srivastwa <
shankar.srivastwa@antrepriz.com>, Rudresh Pratap Singh <
rudresh.pratap@antrepriz.com>, Basant Patel <basant@antrepriz.com>


Hi Abhishek & Team,

Please find the attached sheet containing the masters for all modules. We
kindly request you to try to gather the master data templates, policies,
and process flow understanding before the sales handover to the
implementation team. This will help us save time currently being spent on
data gathering.

*       1. Templates for Data Gathering*

*       2. Reports for the following*

   - Employee Expense Report
   - Travel Report
   - MJP Plan Report
   - MJP Item Report
   - QR Card Report
   - QR Ledger Report
   - Mileage Tracking Report
   - Utility Report
   - Advance Report

*      3. Feature List*

   - Travel Module
   - Expense Module
   - Petty Cash Module
   - Utility Module
   - Procurement
   - Accounts Payable



*Link
- https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/19GMNP89HB-PCR0a7JPCfIl4K1kwf8iFQyhvuQ84cY7E/edit?gid=0#gid=0
<https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/19GMNP89HB-PCR0a7JPCfIl4K1kwf8iFQyhvuQ84cY7E/edit?gid=0#gid=0>*Additionally,
it would be helpful to check the feasibility of integrations, specifically:

   - *HRMS: *Confirm if APIs are available to share employee data or
   relevant fields.
   - *Bank:* Verify if the bank supports UPI payouts, and if they require
   IMPS, RTGS, or NEFT during payouts
   - *ERP:* Check if they have a support team, either in-house IT or a
   third-party vendor.
   - *SSO:* Ensure they have Active Directory (AD) for Single Sign-On.

This is important because the commercials are based on these integrations,
and clients sometimes deny them due to feasibility issues or lack of
support.

Let us know if you need any additional info on this.
-- 

Thanks & Regards,

Ekta Singh

9427477343


Dice
www.dice.tech

[image: Dice Logo]

One app to manage all spends.

Payables | Reimburse | Travel | Procure | Subscription | Wallet
Visit Us
<https://dice.tech/>

without consent is prohibited.


-- 


*Ayush SrivastavaPre Sales & Solutions Manager*

*+91-7488895274*

subject: Re: Great Meeting You at Middle East ProcureTech Summit – Let’s Continue the Conversation
body:
Hi Ritvik,

Hope you're doing well.

Thankyou for giving us your time.It was a pleasure meeting you and gaining
insights into your *source-to-pay process*. As you finalize *SAP Ariba*, I
wanted to share how *Dice’s AI-powered spend orchestration platform* can
seamlessly integrate with your ERP to *enhance vendor management, automate
invoice processing, and streamline procurement workflows*.

Manual invoice handling and fragmented supplier collaboration often result
in *delayed approvals, reconciliation inefficiencies, and uncontrolled
spending*. Dice’s AI-driven automation addresses these challenges by:

   - *Accelerating Invoice Processing by 80%* – AI-powered validation
   automates *2-way/3-way matching*, eliminating bottlenecks.
   - *Reducing Maverick Spend by 40%* – Ensures compliance-driven
   purchasing through AI-powered spend analytics.
   - *Seamless S/4HANA Integration* – Enabling *real-time PO-to-invoice
   matching, automated reconciliation, and vendor collaboration*.
   - *Enhancing Supplier Collaboration* – Streamlining approvals and *cutting
   procurement lead times by 35%*.
   - *AI-Driven Procurement Insights* – Delivering *real-time spend
   visibility, anomaly detection, and contract optimization* for smarter
   decision-making.

Additionally, for your reference, I have attached a *comparative analysis
between SAP Ariba and Dice*. This will provide a clear perspective on how
Dice can complement and enhance your procurement and payables processes.

Would love to explore how we can tailor this for your team. Let me know if
sometime next week works for you.

Looking forward to your thoughts.

*Best regards,*


*Himanshi JoshiGrowth Consultant*

*+91-9630827366*

Dice
www.dice.tech

[image: https://www.linkedin.com/in/himanshi-joshi-39ba12202/]
<https://www.linkedin.com/in/himanshi-joshi-39ba12202/>

<https://dice.tech/>

With Hira Industries leveraging

SAP Ariba, optimizing 
procurement efficiency is crucial.
Dice’s AI-powered spend orchestration platform seamlessly integrates with your ERP to streamline
vendor management, invoice automation, and procurement workflows.
We’ve worked with Bajaj and
GMR to enhance procurement in
manufacturing, enabling:


Automated Supplier Collaboration – Faster approvals, reduced lead times, and improved compliance.
AI-Driven Procurement Insights – Optimizing sourcing decisions and spend management.
Seamless SAP Ariba Integration – Ensuring smooth transition and adoption.
PurchaseGPT, our AI-powered procurement assistant, further enhances this by
automating vendor selection, contract management, and approval workflows—reducing cycle times and improving compliance.
I’d love to discuss how Dice and
PurchaseGPT can bring similar efficiencies to
Hira Industries. I’m available for an
in-person meeting on Tuesday at 10:30 AM. I’ve sent a calendar invite—please confirm if this works for you.
Looking forward to your thoughts.

To give you a quick overview, Dice is a leader in providing end-to-end solutions for Travel and Expense Management. Our platform automates everything from booking and expense reporting to reimbursements, ensuring greater accuracy and compliance for your organization.

The unique value of our Mileage Tracking feature, providing real-time tracking and automatic reimbursements.
Integration capabilities with your existing systems for seamless operations.

subject: Re: Meeting with United Foods
body:
Hi Mahmud and Avinash,

Thank you for taking the time to meet the other day. It was a pleasure
having a great discussion with you.

In today’s dynamic business landscape, manual invoice processing not only
increases operational overhead but also introduces compliance risks and
inefficiencies. *PayableGPT* offers an intelligent, AI-driven solution that
addresses these challenges by:

   - *Automating Invoice Validation & **Approval Insights*  : AI-powered
   data extraction and *real-time 2-way/3-way matching* eliminate
   discrepancies and accelerate approvals by identifying  bottlenecks and
   reducing cycle times by *60%*.
   - *Enhancing Financial Accuracy*: Advanced fraud detection and duplicate
   invoice prevention ensure compliance and mitigate payment risks.
   - *Predictive Invoice Processing*: AI-driven insights optimize payment
   cycles and working capital.
   - *Streamlining Workflow Approvals*: Configurable AI-driven workflows
   reduce manual intervention and improve cycle times.
   - *Seamless Integration with SAP ECC6*: Automated posting and
   reconciliation enable frictionless ERP synchronization, reducing processing
   time by over 60%.

[image: Thumbnail for the playlist PayableGPT v1.0]
<https://share.vidyard.com/watch/mogLwNQw2M5o6jwwT9hhwA?autoplay=1&vyetoken=7a7c29a3-1733-45f8-99b7-51bafc02ffdf>
PayableGPT v1.0
<https://share.vidyard.com/watch/mogLwNQw2M5o6jwwT9hhwA?autoplay=1&vyetoken=7a7c29a3-1733-45f8-99b7-51bafc02ffdf>

As United Foods continues its digital transformation, we would welcome the
opportunity to engage further with you and your team to explore how
*PayableGPT* can enhance efficiency and strengthen financial controls.

Please let us know if *Tuesday next week around 12 pm *works for you.

Looking forward to hearing from you.

Regards,


*Himanshi JoshiGrowth Consultant*

*+91-9630827366*

Dice
www.dice.tech

[image: https://www.linkedin.com/in/himanshi-joshi-39ba12202/]
<https://www.linkedin.com/in/himanshi-joshi-39ba12202/>

<https://dice.tech/>

Hi Mahmud and Avinash,Thank you for taking the time to meet the other day. It was a pleasure having a great discussion with you.  In today’s dynamic business landscape, manual invoice processing not only increases operational overhead but also introduces compliance risks and inefficiencies. PayableGPT offers an intelligent, AI-driven solution that addresses these challenges by:Automating Invoice Validation & Approval Insights  : AI-powered data extraction and real-time 2-way/3-way matching eliminate discrepancies and accelerate approvals by identifying  bottlenecks and reducing cycle times by 60%.  Enhancing Financial Accuracy: Advanced fraud detection and duplicate invoice prevention ensure compliance and mitigate payment risks.Predictive Invoice Processing: AI-driven insights optimize payment cycles and working capital.Streamlining Workflow Approvals: Configurable AI-driven workflows reduce manual intervention and improve cycle times.  Seamless Integration with SAP ECC6: Automated posting and reconciliation enable frictionless ERP synchronization, reducing processing time by over 60%.PayableGPT v1.0As United Foods continues its digital transformation, we would welcome the opportunity to engage further with you and your team to explore how PayableGPT can enhance efficiency and strengthen financial controls. Please let us know if Tuesday next week around 12 pm works for you.Looking forward to hearing from you.Regards,Himanshi JoshiGrowth Consultant+91-9630827366Dicewww.dice.techOn Fri, Feb 28, 2025 at 1:14 PM Sonam Khubchandani <sonam@dice.tech> wrote:Hi Mamdouh & Avinash,Thanks for having us at your office.
